availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John D. Taggart (Louisville, Kentucky, pork packer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, pork packer. Native of Ireland. Married to Mary Ann Russell in Nelson County, Kentucky, on April 5, 1852. Father of James H. Taggart, Anna Taggart, Sallie Taggart, Mary Ella Taggart, and John D. Taggart Jr. Co-owner of pork-packing company A. S. White & Co. in partnership with Andrew S White, James S. White, Samuel P. Weiseger in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 545A.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Film # 000481488, Nelson County, April 5, 1852 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky, Birth Records, 1847-1911, Jefferson County, March 6, 1857, (accessed via ancestry.com).
